name: Acquired Space Agency
economy: 6 ti = 18 MC (24 as Phobolog). 2 space cards from reveal = ~8-10 MC value (not random, you see before picking). Total ~26-28 MC but volatile.
reasoning: Above average value when you can spend the titanium on gen 1 space cards. The 2 revealed space cards add significant value — you know what opponents saw. Variance is the main downside: sometimes the ti has no good targets. No tags is a minor penalty.
when_to_pick: When you have space cards in hand or are playing Phobolog/Saturn Systems. Skip if your hand is all building/earth.

name: Allied Bank
economy: 4 MC-prod = 20-24 MC gen 1. +3 MC immediate. +Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~25-30 MC.
reasoning: One of the best production preludes. 4 MC-prod is flexible and always useful. Earth tag is relevant for Point Luna, Cartels, Space Hotels. No downside, no requirements. Slightly below Business Empire ceiling but more reliable (no cost).
when_to_pick: Almost always a good pick. Slightly better in longer games (more gens to benefit from production).

name: Anti-desertification Techniques
economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 3 MC immediate. 2 tags ~3 MC. Total ~22 MC.
reasoning: Below average value at ~22 MC. The 2 tags (Microbe+Plant) can be useful for Ecologist milestone or Splice, but 1 plant-prod alone is weak — attracts hate without providing enough for conversion. Steel-prod is nice but only 1. Community rates it weak.
when_to_pick: Only when tags matter for your strategy (Ecologist, Splice) and other preludes are worse. Generally skip.

name: Applied Science
economy: 6 science resources on this card. Action: spend 1 science for 1 ti/plant-prod OR spend 4 science for 1 VP each. Without Physics Complex, self-contained value is ~6 ti-prod (slow, 6 actions) or mix of prod+VP.
reasoning: A prelude that gives zero immediate value — no MC, no production, no TR. In gen 1, you get nothing to build your engine. The science resources are only useful with Physics Complex (spend 6 for 12 VP) or as slow prod gain. Wild tag is minor. Production preludes far outperform this.
when_to_pick: Only with Physics Complex in opening hand. Otherwise one of the worst preludes.

name: Aquifer Turbines
economy: 1 ocean = ~12 MC (1 TR + placement bonus). 2 energy-prod = 15 MC. -3 MC cost. Power tag ~1 MC. Total ~25 MC.
reasoning: Solid prelude with good total value. Ocean gives immediate TR + placement bonus (could be 2 cards on Tharsis). 2 energy-prod is excellent with Colonies (trade immediately) or energy-hungry cards (Strip Mine, Electro Catapult). The -3 MC is minor. Less good without energy sinks.
when_to_pick: When you have energy sinks in hand or are playing with Colonies. Good on Tharsis for ocean placement bonuses.

name: Atmospheric Enhancers
economy: 2 raises on any parameter = ~14-15 MC (2 TR). 2 floater-icon cards from reveal = ~8 MC. Venus tag ~2 MC. Total ~24-25 MC, but flexibility is huge.
reasoning: Extremely flexible — choose which parameter to raise based on board state. 2 TR is strong. The 2 floater-icon cards drawn are a bonus. Can unlock Venus requirements early (for Stratospheric Birds gen 1 with Venus L1 Shade combo). Venus tag relevant for Morning Star Inc and discounts.
when_to_pick: When you have Venus cards in hand or want flexible TR. Great with Morning Star Inc. Good even without Venus synergy since you can raise temp/O2.

name: Biofuels
economy: 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 2 plants = ~3 MC. Microbe tag ~1 MC. Total ~19.5 MC.
reasoning: Well below average value (~19.5 MC vs 24.5 average). Weak production spread, bad tag. COTD consensus: 'pretty bad'. Only marginally useful if you desperately need energy for something and have Ecoline for plant conversion. Bottom 20% of preludes.
when_to_pick: Almost never. Only if you desperately need energy prod and nothing better is available.

name: Biolab
economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 3 random cards = 9-12 MC. Science tag ~3 MC. Total ~20-23 MC.
reasoning: Below average value. 1 plant-prod is weak standalone. 3 random cards are a gamble — you might get nothing useful. Science tag is the main draw (unlock requirements, Scientist award). COTD consensus: 'bottom 20% prelude, only playable with bad hand'. Better preludes exist for both production and card draw.
when_to_pick: Only when you need the Science tag to unlock something critical in gen 1, or your other preludes are truly terrible.

name: Biosphere Support
economy: 2 plant-prod = 16 MC, -1 MC-prod = -5 MC. Plant tag ~2 MC. Total ~13 MC.
reasoning: One of the worst preludes. The -1 MC-prod is devastating in gen 1 when you only have ~20 MC production. 2 plant-prod alone rarely justifies losing MC income. COTD top comment: 'it sucks'. The plant tag is its only saving grace for NRA. Dome Farming is strictly better (same tag, better production, no MC loss).
when_to_pick: Almost never. Only Ecoline with NRA in hand where you desperately need 3 plant tags. Bottom 5 prelude.

name: Board of Directors
economy: 4 director resources. Action: spend 1 director → look at top 5 cards, buy up to 2 for 3 MC each. Earth тег ~2-3 MC. 4 uses = look at 20 cards, buy up to 8 for 3 MC each. Best cards ~7-10 MC value at 3 MC cost = ~4-7 MC profit per use. Total ~16-28 MC + Earth тег over 4 uses.
reasoning: Card filtering action — 4 directors дают 4 uses за игру. Каждое use: look at 5, buy up to 2 for 3 MC. Это дешевле стандартных 3 MC/card, но не бесплатно — нужно 3 MC per card. При 1 good card per look: 4 x ~5 MC profit = ~20 MC total value. Проблема: нет immediate value gen 1 (0 MC, 0 prod, 0 resources). Earth тег — единственный немедленный бонус. Slow engine card на прелюдии, что плохо — прелюдии должны давать tempo gen 1.
when_to_pick: Когда вам нужен card draw pipeline и Earth тег. Лучше с Point Luna. Не приоритетная — immediate value слишком мала для прелюдии.

name: Business Empire
economy: 6 MC-prod = 30-36 MC gen 1. -6 MC cost. Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~26-33 MC net.
reasoning: High production value but the 6 MC cost delays payoff to gen 3. Better than Allied Bank in ceiling (6 vs 4 prod) but worse floor due to cost crippling gen 1 spending. Earth tag is nice. COTD: 'very popular, income is what you want gen 1'. Best with rich corps (Credicor, Teractor) that can absorb the cost.
when_to_pick: When you have enough starting MC to absorb the 6 MC cost without crippling gen 1. Better in longer games.

name: Colony Trade Hub
economy: 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 2 ti = 6 MC, effect +2 MC per colony placed. Need 6 colonies for full value (~12 MC additional). Total ~13 MC base + colony bonus.
reasoning: Very weak base value (~13 MC). The colony bonus is too slow — need 6+ colonies to reach average prelude value, which rarely happens in 8-9 gen game. Space tag is minor. COTD (benbever): 'only worth ~13 in quantified value'. One of the weakest Prelude 2 cards.
when_to_pick: Only in 4-5 player games with aggressive colony placement. In 3P, almost never reaches average value.

name: Corporate Archives
economy: 13 MC + look at 7, keep 2 cards = ~6-10 MC (better than random due to selection). Science tag ~3 MC. Total ~22-26 MC.
reasoning: Solid 'money now + smart card draw' prelude. The 7-card selection makes the 2 drawn cards significantly better than random (~8-10 MC value vs ~6-8 for random). Science tag is relevant. Less good with bad hands (digging for outs is unreliable). COTD: 'above average, good with good hands'.
when_to_pick: When your hand is already decent and you want to find specific synergy cards. The Science tag unlocks requirements. Skip if you need raw production.

name: Corridors of Power
economy: 1 TR = 7 MC, 4 MC immediate, Earth tag ~2 MC. Effect: ~1 card/gen in 3P = ~3 MC/gen for ~7 gens = ~21 MC. Total ~34 MC if effect fires every gen.
reasoning: High theoretical value but inconsistent in 3P. Becoming party leader every gen is realistic in 2P but harder in 3P (competition for lobbying). The 1 TR + 4 MC base is mediocre alone. Earth tag is nice. Overall decent but not spectacular — the effect's value is highly variable. Turmoil-dependent.
when_to_pick: When playing Turmoil-focused strategy or Septum Tribus. Less reliable in competitive 3P lobbying.

name: Dome Farming
economy: 2 MC-prod = 10-12 MC, 1 plant-prod = 8 MC. Plant tag ~2 MC, Building tag ~2 MC (Robotic Workforce target). Total ~22-24 MC.
reasoning: Slightly below average in raw value but the 2 tags are genuinely useful. Building tag makes it a Robotic Workforce target (+10 MC value if copied). Plant tag for NRA, Ecologist. COTD: 'not bad, tags are the most useful thing'. Solid filler but not exciting.
when_to_pick: When you need the Plant+Building tag combo, or have Robotic Workforce. Acceptable filler prelude.

name: Donation
economy: 21 MC flat. No tags, no production. Average prelude benchmark.
reasoning: The baseline prelude — exactly average historically but slightly below the current ~24.5 MC average. Raw money is flexible but has no multiplying effect (no production, no tags, no TR). COTD: 'perfectly average, the standard by which others are judged'. Fine with expensive gen 1 cards, underwhelming otherwise.
synergies: Any corp with low starting MC
when_to_pick: When you have expensive cards to play gen 1 and other preludes don't fit. Never exciting but rarely terrible.

name: Double Down
economy: Копирует direct effect другой прелюдии. Value = стоимость другой прелюдии (без тегов и ongoing effects). Average prelude direct effect ~20-25 MC. С лучшими прелюдиями: Great Aquifer x2 = 4 oceans, Huge Asteroid x2 = 6 temp steps.
reasoning: Мультипликатор ценности — ceiling зависит целиком от парной прелюдии. С Great Aquifer (ещё 2 океана) или Huge Asteroid (ещё 3 temp steps) — одна из лучших прелюдий в игре. С Business Empire (ещё +6 MC-prod но ещё -6 MC) — приличная. С production-only прелюдиями — solid. С Donation (ещё 21 MC) — ок. Основная слабость: нет тегов, нужна хорошая парная прелюдия, не копирует ongoing/action effects. Нельзя копировать себя.
when_to_pick: Когда парная прелюдия имеет мощный direct effect. Лучше всего с Great Aquifer, Huge Asteroid, UNMI Contractor. Не берите если парная прелюдия слабая или её ценность в ongoing/action (которые не копируются).

name: Early Colonization
economy: Colony placement = ~13 MC. 3 energy = 1 trade = ~8-12 MC depending on colony. Space tag ~1 MC. Also moves tracks 2 steps up. Total ~24-28 MC.
reasoning: Strong in Colony games. You get a colony + immediate trade capability (3 energy). The colony tracks move 2 steps forward as a bonus. Secures a spot on the best colony before anyone else. Space tag is minor. Less good if colonies are weak.
when_to_pick: When strong colonies are in play and you have (or can get) 3 energy-prod for future trading. Top colony prelude.

name: Early Settlement
economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, city tile = ~5-10 MC (placement bonus + future adjacency). Building+City tags ~3 MC. Total ~16-21 MC.
reasoning: Below average. Cities are overvalued by the game — they cost an action and adjacency VP takes many gens to develop. 1 plant-prod alone is weak. Building+City tags are niche. COTD: 'rarely worth picking'. Only decent for Mayor milestone on Tharsis or primo city spot on Elysium.
when_to_pick: Only on Tharsis for Mayor milestone or if you can grab Olympus Mons on Elysium. Otherwise skip.

name: Eccentric Sponsor
economy: Effectively Donation (25 MC) if you have a 25+ MC card. But: no tag, replaces a prelude slot, useless without target. Expected value ~21-25 MC with target, ~0 without.
reasoning: High variance prelude. When you have an expensive engine card (Io Mining, Space Elevator, Terraforming Ganymede) in opening hand, it is better than Donation (+4 MC). When you don't, it's one of the worst preludes — literally does nothing useful. COTD: 'either great or useless, usually useless'. No tag is a penalty.
when_to_pick: Only when you have a 25+ MC card you want to play gen 1. If you don't have the target, never pick this.

name: Ecology Experts
economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC. Free card play ignoring requirements = 0-30+ MC depending on target. Plant+Microbe tags ~3 MC. Total ~11 MC (no target) to ~40+ MC (Kelp Farming/NRA).
reasoning: Extremely swingy. With Kelp Farming, Trees, Bushes, or NRA in hand — one of the best preludes in the game. Without a strong target — one of the worst, since 1 plant-prod + 2 tags alone is ~11 MC. COTD (benbever): 'best quantified value after Merger, but only works with a couple of cards'. Score reflects average case across all hands.
when_to_pick: Only when you have a strong card with a global requirement you can't meet otherwise. Without target = bad prelude.

name: Experimental Forest
economy: 1 greenery = 1 TR + O2 raise + placement bonus (~12-15 MC). 2 plant-tag cards from reveal = ~8-10 MC (selected, не random). Plant тег ~2 MC. Total ~22-27 MC + strategic board presence gen 1.
reasoning: Отличная прелюдия для ground game. Greenery gen 1 — мощный tempo: 1 TR + oxygen + placement bonus + board presence. 2 plant-tag cards из колоды — гарантированный pipeline для plant-стратегии. На Tharsis placement bonuses могут включать 2 cards или steel. Plant тег для NRA, Ecologist. Сравнима с Project Eden по ground game impact, но без city/ocean. Стабильно сильная.
when_to_pick: Plant/ground game стратегия. Особенно с Ecoline. На Tharsis для Gardener milestone. 2 plant-карты из колоды обеспечивают pipeline на следующие поколения.

name: Floating Trade Hub
economy: 2 floaters/action, convert to standard resource. ~3 MC/gen as titanium (1 ti every 1.5 gens average). Space tag ~1 MC. With other floater cards, value increases.
reasoning: Slow engine card on a prelude. 2 floaters/action is decent but converting to ti is only ~3 MC/gen. No immediate value — zero MC, zero production gen 1. Space tag is minor. Better with other floater cards to feed. Floater trap concerns apply somewhat, though this is cheaper than most floater cards.
when_to_pick: When you have floater synergies and other immediate-value preludes covering your gen 1 needs. Alone = weak.

name: Focused Organization
economy: Immediate: draw 1 card (~3-4 MC) + gain 1 standard resource (~2-3 MC). Action: discard 1 card + spend 1 standard resource → draw 1 card + gain 1 standard resource. Net action value = ~0 MC (trade 1 card + 1 resource for 1 card + 1 resource). Total immediate ~5-7 MC + cycling value.
reasoning: На первый взгляд action кажется бесплатным cycling, но это ровно trade 1:1 — вы тратите карту и ресурс, получаете карту и ресурс. Ценность в filtering: вы можете сбросить плохую карту и получить random (может быть лучше). Можно конвертировать steel в titanium или наоборот. Immediate value очень низкая (~6 MC). Action полезна mid/late game для cycling ненужных карт. Без ongoing production или immediate value — одна из слабейших прелюдий по gen 1 impact.
when_to_pick: Когда нужен resource conversion или card filtering и другие прелюдии хуже. Не приоритетный pick — immediate value слишком мала.

name: Galilean Mining
economy: 2 ti-prod = 25 MC theoretical. -5 MC cost. Jovian tag ~3 MC. Total ~23 MC. BUT ti-prod only pays if you have space cards AND vulnerable to AMC.
reasoning: Sounds good on paper (2 ti-prod + Jovian tag) but deeply flawed. The -5 MC cost means it doesn't start paying until gen 3. Ti-prod is useless without Space cards to spend it on, and vulnerable to AMC stealing. COTD: 'pretty bad' (shai_aus), 'one of the worst preludes' (ad_hocNC, icehawk84). Inflexible and risky.
when_to_pick: Only with Saturn Systems or when you need Jovian tag for Rim Settler. Otherwise one of the weakest preludes.

name: Giant Solar Collector
economy: 2 energy-prod = 15 MC, 1 Venus step = ~4-5 MC (Venus TR less valuable). Power+Space tags ~2 MC. Total ~21-22 MC.
reasoning: Below average. 2 energy-prod is nice for Colonies but the Venus step is less efficient than temp/O2 raises (Venus TR is often wasted). Power+Space tags are rarely useful together. COTD: 'middling to weak with Colonies, terrible without' (Krazyguy75). Supplier is strictly better (same energy, 4 steel > 1 Venus step).
when_to_pick: Only with Colonies when you need energy for trading and Venus synergy. Otherwise skip.

name: Great Aquifer
economy: 2 oceans = 2 TR (~14-15 MC) + 2 placement bonuses (~4-8 MC average). Kickstarts ground game. Total ~18-23 MC direct, but strategic value much higher.
reasoning: Top-tier prelude. 2 oceans provides immediate 2 TR, excellent placement bonuses (up to 2 cards + 2 ti on Tharsis), and controls the ocean track. Enables Arctic Algae, Kelp Farming. COTD consensus: 'among the best preludes' (icehawk84), 'top tier, kickstarts ground game' (ad_hocNC). Strategic value exceeds raw MC calculation.
when_to_pick: Almost always a strong pick. Best on Tharsis (placement bonuses). Slightly less good if you have zero ground game cards.

name: High Circles
economy: 1 TR = 7 MC. 1 card with party requirement = ~3-4 MC. 2 delegates in one party = ~6 MC (3 MC/delegate). Permanent +1 influence = ~3-5 MC/gen (better dominant bonuses, chairman votes). Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~21-24 MC base + ~24-40 MC influence value over 8 gen.
reasoning: Одна из сильнейших прелюдий для Turmoil-игр. Permanent +1 influence — уникальный эффект, который масштабируется всю игру: лучшие dominant bonuses, больше влияния на chairman. 2 delegates в одну партию дают немедленный political control. 1 TR + Earth тег — solid base. Карта с party requirement обычно сильная (они balanced вокруг requirement). Без Turmoil — бесполезна, но с ним — одна из лучших прелюдий.
when_to_pick: Всегда берите в Turmoil-играх. Permanent +1 influence масштабируется экспоненциально. Особенно сильна с Septem Tribus (больше delegates = больше parties = больше MC/action).

name: Huge Asteroid
economy: 3 temp steps = 3 TR (~21-22 MC) + heat-prod from 0->-2 step = ~4 MC. -5 MC cost. Total ~20 MC direct, but 3 TR is massive tempo.
reasoning: Excellent rush prelude. 3 TR is the highest immediate TR from any standard prelude. The heat production from temp steps is a bonus. The -5 MC is a real cost but 3 TR + heat prod is worth it. Unlocks temperature-dependent cards. COTD (benbever): 'in the top 10 best preludes by quantified value'.
when_to_pick: Strong in rush strategies. Good when you have temp-requirement cards. The 5 MC cost means less good if you're cash-starved.

name: Industrial Complex
economy: Sets all <1 productions to 1. For zero-production corp: +1 steel(8)+1 ti(12.5)+1 plant(8)+1 energy(7.5)+1 heat(4) = ~40 MC theoretical. -18 MC cost. Building tag ~2 MC. But most corps start with SOME production.
reasoning: High ceiling but very corp-dependent. With corps that start at all zeros (Credicor, Point Luna), you get massive value. With corps that already have production (Mining Guild, Ecoline), it's terrible — you pay 18 MC for almost nothing. COTD: 'not compatible with corps that give production'. Building tag is nice. Average case ~22-25 MC.
when_to_pick: Only with corps that start at 0 production across the board. Never with Ecoline, Mining Guild, Helion, etc.

name: Io Research Outpost
economy: 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC, 1 card = 3-4 MC. Jovian+Science tags = ~6 MC. Total ~21-23 MC.
reasoning: Below average. 1 ti-prod + 1 card is underwhelming for a prelude slot. The Jovian+Science double tag is the main attraction but even then the total value is mediocre. COTD: 'one of the worst preludes' (ad_hocNC), 'weak card' (FieldMouse007). Only playable with Saturn Systems or when you need both tags for milestones.
when_to_pick: Only with Saturn Systems or when both Jovian+Science tags are critical for your strategy.

name: Loan
economy: 30 MC - 2 MC-prod (= -10 MC gen 1 value). Net ~20 MC. No tags = -3 MC penalty. Total ~17 MC effective.
reasoning: One of the worst preludes. 30 MC sounds great but -2 MC-prod is brutal in gen 1 — you're cutting into your already thin 20 MC production. COTD (benbever): 'one of the worst preludes in quantified value'. Only justified if the 30 MC enables a game-changing gen 1 play that wouldn't happen otherwise. No tags hurts further.
when_to_pick: Only when 30 MC enables a critical gen 1 play (e.g., Io Mining) and you have no better production prelude.

name: Main Belt Asteroids
economy: -5 MC. Action: add 1 asteroid to any card. Effect: each asteroid on this = 1 ti + 0.5 VP. Self-contained: ~1 ti-prod equivalent. Space tag ~1 MC. Total ~15 MC base + ~3 MC/gen ongoing.
reasoning: Slow but steady value. The -5 MC hurts gen 1. Self-contained it's about 1 ti-prod + 0.5 VP/gen which is decent but not exciting. Better with Astrodrill or other asteroid cards. Space tag is minor. COTD (benbever): values it reasonably. Middle-low prelude.
when_to_pick: When you have asteroid synergies (Astrodrill). Without synergy, it's below average.

name: Martian Industries
economy: 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 6 MC immediate. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~23.5 MC.
reasoning: Just barely below average. The production mix is uninspiring — 1 of each doesn't build toward anything specific. The 6 MC immediate helps gen 1 spending. Building tag is fine. COTD: 'nothing offensive but nothing great' (shai_aus). Only good when energy is specifically needed (Colonies, Electro Catapult).
when_to_pick: When you specifically need energy production for a gen 1 play. Otherwise there are better options.

name: Merger
economy: Draw 4 corps, play 1, pay 42 MC. Net = second corp's ability + starting MC - 42. Extremely variable: from +50 MC (great corp synergy) to -20 MC (bad draws).
reasoning: The most volatile prelude. When it hits (Tharsis + Point Luna combo, etc.), it's game-winning. When it misses, you paid 42 MC for a mediocre second corp with depleted resources. COTD: 'broken in the literal sense — pure RNG' (Krazyguy75). No tags. The fun factor is high but reliability is low. Score reflects average expected value.
synergies: Valley Trust (9 preludes to look at)
when_to_pick: When your current setup is mediocre and you're willing to gamble. Skip if you already have a strong hand — the 42 MC cost is real.

name: Metal-Rich Asteroid
economy: 1 temp step = 1 TR (~7 MC) + heat-prod bonus. 4 ti = 12 MC, 4 steel = 8 MC. Total ~28-30 MC if metals are spent.
reasoning: High value prelude (~30 MC when metals are spent). 1 TR is immediate tempo. 4 ti + 4 steel provides flexible gen 1 spending for both space and building cards. COTD (benbever): 'top 10 best preludes'. The key condition is having cards to spend the metals on — if you don't, metals are worth less. No tags is the only downside.
when_to_pick: When you have building and space cards to spend the metals. Almost always a strong pick.

name: Metals Company
economy: 1 MC-prod = 5 MC, 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~22.5 MC. BUT diverse production is very flexible.
reasoning: Best pure-production prelude for engine building. Gives a bit of everything — MC for flexibility, steel for buildings, ti for space cards. No tags is a real penalty but the production diversity compensates. COTD consensus: 'great, gives a bit of everything' (shai_aus), 'literally the best income prelude' (FieldMouse007).
when_to_pick: Almost always good for engine-building strategies. Less good in pure rush. Solid default pick.

name: Mining Operations
economy: 2 steel-prod = 16 MC, 4 steel = 8 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~26 MC IF you can spend the steel.
reasoning: Above average raw value but highly conditional on having building cards. If your hand is space/science-heavy, the steel is nearly worthless. 2 steel-prod is a lot — you need consistent building card flow. COTD: 'feels like overkill' (shai_aus), 'situational' (FieldMouse007). Decent with heavy building strategy.
when_to_pick: Only when you have 3+ building cards in hand. Without building targets, much weaker.

name: Mohole
economy: 3 heat-prod = 12 MC (at 4 MC/heat-prod), 3 heat = ~2 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~16 MC. Heat-prod is the least efficient production.
reasoning: Below average. Heat production is overpriced and least efficient in the game. 3 heat-prod sounds impressive but heat is the cheapest resource. COTD (Krazyguy75): 'this prelude sucks'. Building tag is nice for Robotic Workforce. Only good for Helion (heat = MC) or dedicated rush strategies. Polar Industries is better (ocean + heat).
when_to_pick: Only as Helion (where heat-prod = MC-prod) or for Robotic Workforce target. Otherwise avoid.

name: Mohole Excavation
economy: 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 2 heat-prod = 8 MC, 2 heat = ~1 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~19 MC.
reasoning: Below average. Unfocused production split between steel and heat is underwhelming. 2 heat-prod is weak. COTD (benbever): 'below average value, not very interesting'. Building tag helps slightly. Strictly worse than Mining Operations (which gives 2 steel-prod + 4 steel instead of 1 steel + 2 heat).
when_to_pick: Almost never. Only as Helion or if you need Building tag and nothing better exists.

name: New Partner
economy: 1 MC-prod = 5 MC + draw 2 preludes, play 1. Expected extra prelude value = ~20-25 MC (the better of 2 random). No tags. Total ~25-30 MC expected.
reasoning: Effective mulligan for preludes. If your other preludes are mediocre, this gives you a shot at something better plus 1 MC-prod. The variance is the issue — you might draw 2 bad preludes. COTD: 'consider this top tier as it is a mulligan with a bonus' (ad_hocNC). Best when other preludes are weak; worst when they're already good.
when_to_pick: When your other preludes are mediocre and you want a reroll. Skip if you already have 2 great preludes.

name: Nitrogen Shipment
economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 1 TR = 7 MC, 5 MC immediate. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~17 MC.
reasoning: One of the worst preludes. A little bit of everything but not enough of anything. No tags makes it even worse. COTD: 'in the contest for worst prelude' (shai_aus), 'average value that is actually not good' (benbever). The production and TR are too spread thin to matter.
when_to_pick: Almost never. Only when all other options are truly terrible.

name: Nobel Prize
economy: 5 MC + 2 VP (= ~10 MC mid-game) + 2 requirement cards (~8 MC from selection) + Wild tag ~2 MC. Total ~25 MC. BUT 2 VP does nothing for gen 1 engine.
reasoning: Looks decent on paper but 2 VP on a prelude is terrible — VP does nothing to build your engine early. 5 MC is minimal. The 2 requirement cards are a gamble (might not hit what you need). COTD (icehawk84): 'absolutely horrendous, 2 VP is not something you want in a prelude'. Wild tag is minor consolation.
when_to_pick: Almost never. Production preludes are strictly better for gen 1. Only if other options are terrible.

name: Old Mining Colony
economy: 1 colony = ~13 MC, 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC, -1 card = -3 MC. Space tag ~1 MC. Total ~23.5 MC.
reasoning: About average value. Colony placement is nice but discarding a card hurts. 1 ti-prod is decent. Space tag is minor. COTD (benbever): 'it is ok, ~23 in quantified value'. Worse than Early Colonization (which gives a trade too) and does not provide energy for future trading.
when_to_pick: When colonies are good and you have a junk card to discard. Early Colonization is generally better.

name: Orbital Construction Yard
economy: 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC, 4 ti = 12 MC. Space tag ~1 MC. Total ~25.5 MC IF ti is spent. Vulnerable to AMC.
reasoning: Average raw value but highly conditional. 4 ti + 1 ti-prod is a lot of titanium — you need space cards to spend it. Vulnerable to Asteroid Mining Consortium stealing the production. COTD: 'not great' (shai_aus), 'below average, often have 2 better options' (benbever). Less flexible than Metal-Rich Asteroid.
when_to_pick: When you have multiple space cards in hand. Skip if your hand is building/earth-focused or if AMC risk is high.

name: Planetary Alliance
economy: 2 TR = 14 MC. 1 Jovian card = ~4-5 MC (selected). 1 Venus card = ~4-5 MC (selected). 3 тега: Earth (~2-3 MC) + Jovian (~3-5 MC) + Venus (~2 MC) = ~7-10 MC. Total ~29-34 MC.
reasoning: Prелюдия с огромной tag-density и solid TR. 3 тега (Earth + Jovian + Venus) — редкая комбинация, которая триггерит Aridor, Saturn Systems, Point Luna, всевозможные tag-dependent milestones. 2 TR — отличный immediate value. Jovian card + Venus card обеспечивают два стратегических направления. Основная сила — в универсальности тегов и flexibility полученных карт. Venus-dependent (нужен Venus модуль).
when_to_pick: Почти всегда сильна при игре с Venus. Особенно ценна с Saturn Systems (Jovian тег + Jovian карта) и Point Luna (Earth тег). 3 тега для Diversifier milestone.

name: Polar Industries
economy: 2 heat-prod = 8 MC, 1 ocean = ~12 MC (1 TR + placement bonus). Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~22 MC direct, but ocean + heat synergy is strong.
reasoning: Solid prelude combining terraforming (ocean) with heat engine. Better than Mohole because the ocean provides immediate TR + placement bonus. Building tag enables Robotic Workforce. COTD (benbever): 'above average, top 10 excluding promos'. Strong for rush strategies. Heat is less flexible but ocean compensates.
when_to_pick: Good for rush or terraforming strategies. Ocean placement bonuses can be excellent on Tharsis.

name: Power Generation
economy: 3 energy-prod = 22.5 MC. Power tag ~1 MC. Total ~23.5 MC. Energy as heat if unused = ~12 MC (3 heat-prod equivalent).
reasoning: Good with Colonies (instant trading capability if you have 3 energy), decent without. 3 energy-prod is a lot — you need sinks (Strip Mine, Electro Catapult) or it becomes expensive heat production. COTD: 'good if you need energy, skippable if not'. Power tag is rarely useful.
when_to_pick: Best with Colonies (can trade gen 1). Also good with energy-hungry cards. Without sinks, it is just expensive heat prod.

name: Preservation Program
economy: 5 TR = 5 MC-prod + 5 VP = ~35 MC (5 x 7 MC). Нет тегов = -3 MC. Total ~32 MC value. Но сравните: UNMI Contractor = 3 TR + 1 card + Earth тег = ~27 MC за 3 TR.
reasoning: 5 TR звучит впечатляюще, но математика неоднозначна. 5 TR = 5 MC-prod which is ~25 MC gen 1 + 5 VP (~25 MC mid-game) = ~50 MC theoretical. Однако TR-prod ценится ниже MC-prod (1 TR ~7 MC vs 1 MC-prod ~5-6 MC gen 1 start). Нет тегов — серьёзный penalty. Нет ресурсов, нет карт, нет production кроме TR. Фактически эта прелюдия не помогает engine building gen 1: вы получаете +5 MC income начиная с gen 2, но gen 1 у вас пустые руки. UNMI Contractor (3 TR + card + Earth tag) часто лучше при score 82. Высокий raw value, но плохой timing и отсутствие тегов снижают оценку.
when_to_pick: При pure TR rush, когда 5 TR ставят вас close к Terraformer milestone. Сочетается с Terraforming Deal (+10 MC from effect). Без rush стратегии — engine building прелюдии лучше.

name: Project Eden
economy: 1 ocean (12 MC) + 1 city (~8 MC) + 1 greenery (~12 MC) + placement bonuses (~6-10 MC) - 3 cards (~9 MC). City+Plant tags ~3 MC. Total ~32-36 MC.
reasoning: Arguably the most broken prelude in the game. 3 tile placements in gen 1 is insane tempo — ocean + city + greenery gives 2 TR + VP + placement bonuses + adjacency potential. Discarding 3 cards is a small price. COTD consensus: 'ridiculously strong' (benbever), 'sooo busted' (icehawk84). Many groups house-rule it. City+Plant tags are a nice bonus.
when_to_pick: Always. This is the strongest standard prelude. Pick it every time you see it.

name: Recession
economy: 10 MC immediate. Opponents: -5 MC each (-10 MC total в 3P) + -1 MC-prod each (-2 MC-prod total). Relative advantage: 10 MC + 10 MC opponent loss + 2 MC-prod opponent loss per gen. Total relative value ~30-35 MC в 3P.
reasoning: Относительная прелюдия — ценность зависит от того, насколько больно оппонентам. 10 MC immediate — ниже среднего. -5 MC и -1 MC-prod для каждого оппонента — болезненно gen 1, но не катастрофично. В 3P (2 оппонента) суммарный relative swing ~30 MC. Проблема: вы сами получаете всего 10 MC — нет production, нет тегов, нет ресурсов. Если оппоненты и так имеют низкий MC-prod (после Business Empire cost или Industrial Complex), эффект слабее. Hate-card которая не строит ваш engine.
when_to_pick: При aggressive rush где вы хотите замедлить оппонентов. Лучше в 3P (2 жертвы) чем в 2P. Не берите если нужен engine — 10 MC не строит ничего.

name: Research Network
economy: 1 MC-prod = 5 MC, 3 cards = 9-12 MC. Wild tag value = highly variable, ~3-8 MC. Total ~17-25 MC depending on tag usage.
reasoning: The Wild tag is the star — counts as any tag for NRA, milestones, awards, and corp abilities. With the right strategy (NRA, Science requirements, Jovian count), the tag alone can be worth 5-10 MC. 1 MC-prod + 3 cards provides modest development. COTD (shai_aus, 27 upvotes): 'I love this one, the Wild tag is amazing'. Less good without tag synergies.
when_to_pick: When the Wild tag fills a critical need (NRA activation, milestone tag count). Less good if you just need raw production.

name: Rise To Power
economy: 3 MC-prod = 15-18 MC. 3 delegates = ~9 MC (3 MC per delegate). No tags = -3 MC. Total ~21-24 MC.
reasoning: Decent combo of production + political influence. 3 delegates in separate parties means 3 party leader positions potentially, which gives influence and chairman TR chances. 3 MC-prod is solid. No tags hurts. Turmoil-dependent. In 3P the political value is moderate — others compete for lobbying.
when_to_pick: When Turmoil matters to your strategy and you want early political control. Less impactful in non-political strategies.

name: Self-Sufficient Settlement
economy: 2 MC-prod = 10-12 MC, city tile = ~5-10 MC. Building+City tags ~3 MC. Total ~18-25 MC.
reasoning: Below average. Cities are overvalued and the 2 MC-prod does not compensate. COTD: 'one of the worst preludes generally' (Krazyguy75), 'meeeh' (shai_aus). Only good on Elysium (Olympus Mons) or Tharsis for Mayor. The Building+City tags have niche value but not enough.
when_to_pick: Only for Mayor milestone on Tharsis or prime city spot on Elysium. Otherwise skip.

name: Smelting Plant
economy: 2 O2 steps = 2 TR (~14-15 MC) + 5 steel = 10 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~26-27 MC.
reasoning: Good value prelude with immediate 2 TR from oxygen. 5 steel is a nice bonus if you have building cards. Building tag enables Robotic Workforce and steel discount. COTD (benbever): 'high value, ~30 MC worth'. Slightly less good if O2 track is the easiest to complete anyway (your greeneries will not give TR). Can be better for engine players counterintuitively.
when_to_pick: When you have building cards to spend the steel. Good if O2 unlocks requirement cards. Solid TR prelude.

name: Society Support
economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 1 heat-prod = 4 MC, -1 MC-prod = -5 MC. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~11.5 MC.
reasoning: The worst or second-worst prelude in the game. Losing MC-prod in gen 1 is devastating, and you get 3 marginal productions in return with no tags at all. COTD (shai_aus): 'no idea what they were thinking'. The total value (~11.5 MC) is less than half the average prelude. Even the no-tag penalty is insult to injury.
when_to_pick: Never. There is virtually no scenario where this is the right pick.

name: Soil Bacteria
economy: 2 microbe cards (selected) = ~8-10 MC. 3 plants = ~5 MC. Microbe тег ~1-2 MC. Total ~14-17 MC direct. Но ценность microbe карт сильно варьируется — Decomposers, Ants, Tardigrades могут быть game-changing.
reasoning: Выглядит слабой по прямому MC value (~15 MC), но ценность заключается в гарантированном доступе к microbe engine. 2 microbe карты из колоды означают, что вы точно получите Decomposers, Ants, Tardigrades, GHG Producing Bacteria или подобные. С Decomposers+Ants — VP machine. 3 plants — приятный бонус для ground game. Microbe тег для Splice, Ecologist. Высокая ceiling при хороших microbe cards в колоде.
when_to_pick: При microbe-стратегии или когда нужен pipeline для VP через microbe engine. Особенно с Splice или EcoTec. 3 plants помогают ground game. Не брать если microbe engine не планируется.

name: Space Lanes
economy: 3 ti = 9 MC. Space тег ~1 MC. Effect: +2 MC per colony trade. 5-8 trades за игру = 10-16 MC. Total ~20-26 MC.
reasoning: Colony-oriented прелюдия с decent base. 3 ti gen 1 помогают с space-картами. Ongoing effect +2 MC per trade — стабильный income в colony games. В 3P с 5-8 trades за игру это ~10-16 MC дополнительного дохода. Space тег для milestone/синергий. Без Colonies effect бесполезен — чистые 3 ti + Space тег (~10 MC). Сильна в colony-heavy meta, средняя без.
when_to_pick: В играх с хорошими колониями, где вы планируете активно торговать. 3 ti gen 1 + ongoing trade bonus = solid combo. Без Colonies — слабая.

name: Strategic Base Planning
economy: City = ~8-12 MC (placement bonus dependent), colony = ~13 MC. -3 MC cost. City+Building+Space tags ~4 MC. Total ~22-26 MC. Needs energy for trading.
reasoning: Strong in the right context: city + colony for 3 MC is excellent efficiency. 3 valuable tags (City, Building, Space). The catch: you need energy production to trade the colony, and city value depends on the map. COTD: 'extremely powerful in right circumstances' (CaptainCFloyd). Better in Colony games with energy available.
when_to_pick: When strong colonies are in play and you have energy for trading. Also good for Mayor milestone on Tharsis.

name: Supplier
economy: 2 energy-prod = 15 MC, 4 steel = 8 MC. Power tag ~1 MC. Total ~24 MC.
reasoning: Solid average prelude. 2 energy-prod is useful with Colonies or energy-hungry cards. 4 steel is decent gen 1 spending. Power tag is rarely relevant. COTD: 'generally like it, upper middle tier' (shai_aus). Not exciting but reliable. Slightly worse than Aquifer Turbines (which adds ocean TR).
when_to_pick: When you need energy for Colonies or have building cards to spend steel on. Decent default pick.

name: Supply Drop
economy: 3 ti = 9 MC, 8 steel = 16 MC, 3 plants = ~5 MC. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~27 MC IF resources spent.
reasoning: High raw value (~27 MC) when you can spend all resources. 8 steel is a lot — you need building cards. 3 ti needs space cards. 3 plants can contribute to an early greenery. The catch: no production means no recurring value. COTD: 'quite strong' (ad_hocNC). No tags hurts. Best in shorter games where immediate resources > production.
when_to_pick: When you have building + space cards to spend resources immediately. Less good without targets.

name: Terraforming Deal
economy: Earth тег ~2-3 MC. Effect: +2 MC per TR step raised. В 3P WGT с 15-20 TR raises за игру (свои) = 30-40 MC. Но это растянуто на 8-9 gen, нет immediate value.
reasoning: Ongoing effect с потенциально высоким total value, но нулевым immediate impact gen 1. 2 MC per TR raise звучит хорошо, но в gen 1 вы получаете 0 MC, 0 production, 0 ресурсов — только Earth тег. Effect начинает окупаться с gen 2-3. В 3P WGT с короткими играми (8-9 gen) total value ~30-40 MC, но распределённый во времени. Для прелюдии, которая должна давать ~24.5 MC value сразу, это слабый gen 1 impact. Earth тег — единственный немедленный бонус.
when_to_pick: При TR rush стратегии, где вы поднимаете 3-5 TR за gen. Сочетается с UNMI. Не берите если ваша стратегия — engine building с поздним terraforming.

name: UNMI Contractor
economy: 3 TR = 3 MC-prod + 3 VP = ~21 MC immediate (3 x 7 MC). 1 card = 3-4 MC. Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~26-28 MC.
reasoning: Top-tier prelude. 3 TR is massive tempo — 3 MC-prod + 3 VP that kicks in immediately. The card draw and Earth tag are bonuses. COTD community rating: very high. Compares favorably to Allied Bank (trades 1 MC-prod for 3 VP + card). Excellent for TR rush. One of the safest, most reliable preludes.
when_to_pick: Almost always a top pick. Especially good for TR rush strategies and Point Luna (Earth tag + card).

name: Venus Contract
economy: 1 Venus card (selected) = ~4-5 MC. 1 TR = 7 MC. Venus тег ~2 MC. Effect: +1 MC per Venus тег played = ~3-6 MC за всю игру (3-6 Venus тегов в 3P). Total ~16-20 MC.
reasoning: Одна из слабейших прелюдий. 1 TR + 1 Venus card + Venus тег — скромный базовый пакет (~13 MC). Ongoing effect +1 MC per Venus tag played звучит как Saturn Systems для Venus, но Venus тегов в колоде значительно меньше чем Jovian. В 3P может быть 3-6 Venus тегов за всю игру = 3-6 MC дополнительно. Суммарно ~16-20 MC — значительно ниже средней прелюдии (24.5 MC). Venus тег полезен только для Venus-стратегии. Без Venus — бесполезна.
when_to_pick: Только при активной Venus-стратегии и отсутствии лучших альтернатив. Слабый immediate value. Morning Star Inc. + Venus L1 Shade дают больше.

name: Venus L1 Shade
economy: 3 Venus steps. Venus TR is ~6-7 MC each (slightly less than temp/O2 due to Venus being less contested). Total = ~18-21 MC. Space tag ~1 MC.
reasoning: 3 Venus steps is solid TR (3 TR = 21 MC at 7 MC/TR) plus it unlocks Venus requirements (8%, 12%, 16% Venus). Space tag is minor. The issue: Venus TR is less impactful because the Venus track does not end the game and the bonuses at 8%/16% are minor compared to temp/O2 bonuses. No COTD data. Worse than Huge Asteroid (3 temp steps + heat-prod for -5 MC).
when_to_pick: When you have Venus strategy cards or Morning Star Inc. Without Venus synergy, Huge Asteroid or Great Aquifer are strictly better.

name: World Government Advisor
economy: 2 TR = ~14 MC immediate. 1 card = 3-4 MC. Earth tag ~2 MC. Action: raise any parameter 1 step each gen = ~7 MC/gen. Total very high if action used every gen.
reasoning: Extremely powerful rush prelude with game-warping action. Using the action every gen accelerates game end by 1-2 gens, which benefits the player if they are ahead in TR. The 2 TR + card + Earth tag base is decent. COTD concerns: 'too influential, can end game early' (benbever). Score reflects that the action is double-edged — shortening the game hurts engine builders including yourself.
when_to_pick: When you are committed to rushing and want to shorten the game. Dangerous if your opponents are also rushing or if you need engine time.

name: CO2Reducers
economy: +3 MC-prod (17 MC value gen 1) + draw 2 microbe cards (~7 MC). Microbe + Venus теги (оба полезны, ~3-4 MC). Total value: ~27-28 MC.
reasoning: Сильная прелюдия. 3 MC-prod — отличная экономическая база gen 1. 2 microbe карты — бонус, иногда попадутся Decomposers/Ants. Два тега (Microbe + Venus) полезны для planetary tracks и корпоративных синергий (Splice, Venus track). Ценность выше среднего (~24.5 MC). Единственный минус — microbe карты могут оказаться слабыми.
when_to_pick: Берём почти всегда — 3 MC-prod универсально полезна. Ещё лучше с microbe/Venus стратегией.

name: CrewTraining
economy: 2 planetary тега по выбору. Каждый planetary тег ≈ 3-5 MC (planetary track advancement + synergies). Total value: ~6-10 MC direct, но стратегическая value выше. NO other effect — нет MC, нет production.
reasoning: Чистая tag-прелюдия без экономического эффекта. 2 planetary тега по выбору — гибко, но value зависит от контекста. 2 Jovian тега с gen 1 = Rim Settler milestone help + Jovian track. 2 Science тега = Research enabler. Проблема: нет MC, нет production — gen 1 экономика страдает. Средняя прелюдия ~24.5 MC, а Crew Training даёт ~8-12 MC в tag value. Значительно ниже среднего по immediate value.
when_to_pick: Берём когда конкретные теги критичны (Rim Settler milestone, planetary track race). Пропускай если нужна экономика gen 1.

name: DeepSpaceOperations
economy: +4 titanium (12 MC immediate) + draw 2 Space event cards (~7 MC, но Space events часто хорошие: Asteroid Mining, Comet). Space тег (~2 MC). Total value: ~21 MC.
reasoning: 4 titanium gen 1 — серьёзный ресурс. Titanium оплачивает Space карты по 3 MC/ti = 12 MC purchasing power для Space cards. 2 Space event карты — приятный бонус (Asteroid Mining = ocean, Comet = ocean + temp). Space тег для planetary track. Чуть ниже среднего prelude value (~21 MC vs 24.5 MC average), но titanium = premium ресурс и Space events часто сильные.
when_to_pick: Берём с Space стратегией и titanium-friendly корпорацией. Phobolog + Deep Space Ops = отличная комбинация.

name: DesignCompany
economy: +1 steel-prod (8 MC value gen 1) + draw 3 building cards (~10.5 MC). Mars тег (~2 MC). Total value: ~20.5 MC.
reasoning: Steel production + 3 building карты = setup для building/steel стратегии. Building карты часто хорошие (Strip Mine, Steel Works, Open City). Mars тег для planetary track — бонус. Value чуть ниже среднего (~20.5 MC), но building карты гарантированно полезны с steel-prod. Хорошая synergy-прелюдия.
when_to_pick: Берём с building/steel стратегией. IC + Design Company = strong combo. Средний pick без steel focus.

name: ExperiencedMartians
economy: 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC) + 1 delegate (3 MC) + draw 2 Mars-tag cards. Mars-tag карт в колоде только 40/700 = могут быть средние. Total ~18-22 MC. Ниже среднего прелюда (24.5 MC).
reasoning: 2 MC-prod и delegate — солидная base value. Но draw 2 Mars-tag cards ограничена пулом: Mars теги только в Pathfinders, и многие Mars карты — средние или ситуативные. Нет тегов на прелюдии. Ниже среднего прелюда.
when_to_pick: Filler прелюдия. 2 MC-prod и delegate нормально, Mars cards draw — бонус.

name: HydrogenBombardment
economy: +1 Venus scale (1 TR = 7 MC) + 1 titanium-prod (12.5 MC value gen 1) + 6 MC immediate. Space + Venus теги (~4 MC). Total value: ~29.5 MC.
reasoning: Одна из лучших Pathfinder прелюдий. 1 TR (Venus scale) + titanium production + 6 MC cash — отличная комбинация early game value. Titanium-prod — самая ценная production в игре (12.5 MC/gen). Space + Venus теги двигают два planetary tracks. 29.5 MC value — значительно выше среднего (24.5 MC). Работает с любой стратегией.
when_to_pick: Берём почти всегда — one of the best preludes. Особенно с Space/Venus стратегией.

name: PersonalAgenda
economy: +3 MC-prod (17 MC value gen 1) + draw 3 non-Space event cards (~10.5 MC). No tags — штраф -2 to -3 MC. Total value: ~24.5-26 MC.
reasoning: 3 MC-prod — топовая экономическая база gen 1. 3 event карты без Space тега — можно получить хорошие дешёвые events (Virus, Energy Tapping, Investment Loan). Проблема: нет тегов на прелюдии. Non-Space restriction означает не получишь Asteroid Mining/Comet. Около среднего значения прелюдий. Надёжная но не выдающаяся.
when_to_pick: Берём как generic production прелюдию. 3 MC-prod хороша всегда. Events — бонус.

name: ResearchGrant
economy: +1 energy-prod (7.5 MC value gen 1) + 14 MC immediate. Science + Science теги (2 тега! ~6-10 MC value для requirements, milestones, synergies). Total value: ~27.5-31.5 MC.
reasoning: Одна из лучших Pathfinder прелюдий. 14 MC cash — огромный immediate boost gen 1. 2 Science тега с gen 1 — великолепно: Olympus Conference, Mars University, Scientist award/milestone, Research requirements, и множество карт с Science requirements. Energy-prod полезна (конвертируется в heat). Value 28-32 MC — значительно выше среднего. 2 Science тега — один из самых ценных аспектов любой прелюдии.
when_to_pick: Берём почти всегда — 14 MC + 2 Science тега = top-tier value. Особенно с Science-dependent картами.

name: SurveyMission
economy: +5 steel (10 MC) + land-claim 3 spaces in triangle (placement bonuses ~3-8 MC + strategic value). Mars тег (~2 MC). Total value: ~15-20 MC + strategic positioning.
reasoning: 5 steel gen 1 — хороший ресурс для building карт. Land-claim 3 spaces в треугольнике — уникальный стратегический эффект: зарезервировать лучшие позиции на карте + получить placement bonuses. На Tharsis можно зарезервировать Noctis City area или ocean-adjacent spots для city+greenery combo. Проблема: pure MC value ниже среднего, value зависит от позиционной стратегии. Mars тег для track — бонус. Сильная для опытных игроков, средняя для остальных.
when_to_pick: Берём с tile-placing стратегией на map-dependent играх. На Tharsis — чуть лучше.

name: TheNewSpaceRace
economy: +12 MC immediate. Science + Earth теги (~5-6 MC). First player for game + choose ruling policy gen 1 (political advantage ~3-5 MC). Total value: ~20-23 MC.
reasoning: Unique ability: revealed BEFORE all other preludes, become starting player, set ruling policy gen 1. 12 MC — приличный cash. Science + Earth теги отличны (Scientist synergies, Earth track). Choosing ruling policy gen 1 = Greens (plant prod), Scientists (draw cards), Mars First (steel) — ситуационно мощно. Проблема: value ruling policy не гарантированна, и becoming first player не всегда выгодно. ~21 MC total — чуть ниже среднего. Requires Turmoil.
when_to_pick: Берём с Turmoil в игре и когда первый ход даёт стратегическое преимущество. Science + Earth теги ценны сами по себе.

name: ValuableGases
economy: +10 MC + play free active floater card (ignore requirements) + 5 floaters on it. Jovian + Venus теги (~5-6 MC). Free card value: card cost saved (0-20+ MC) + 5 floaters (5-15 MC depending on card). Total value: highly variable, 20-45+ MC.
reasoning: Высокодисперсная прелюдия. Ceiling огромный: play Dirigibles free + 5 floaters = 5 MC + 5 floaters (convertible to Venus raises) = ~25-30 MC extra value. Или Celestic free + 5 floaters = ~15 MC. Но нужна floater active card в руке! Без неё — 10 MC + 2 тега = ~16 MC (ужасно). Jovian + Venus теги оба ценны. В среднем (с подходящей картой): ~28-35 MC. Без подходящей карты: ~16 MC. Берём только с floater card.
when_to_pick: ТОЛЬКО с активной floater картой в руке (Dirigibles, Celestic). Без неё — слабая прелюдия.

name: VenusFirst
economy: +2 Venus scale (2 TR = 14 MC) + draw 2 Venus cards (~7 MC). Venus тег (~2-3 MC). Total value: ~23-24 MC.
reasoning: 2 TR через Venus scale gen 1 — хороший immediate value. 2 Venus карты бонусом. Venus тег для planetary track. Проблема: 2 TR через Venus не даёт MC-production (в отличие от temperature/oxygen TR). Venus TR менее 'useful' чем other TR в раннем game. 2 Venus карты могут быть слабыми. Value ~23 MC — около среднего (24.5 MC). Надёжная Venus прелюдия.
synergies: Venus tag corps (Morning Star, Ambient, Robin Haulings)
when_to_pick: Берём с Venus стратегией. 2 TR gen 1 всегда приятно. Без Venus фокуса — средняя.

name: VitalColony
economy: Place colony (13-17 MC value depending on colony) + receive placement bonus TWICE. Mars + Space теги (~4 MC). Лучшие colonies: Luna (2×2 MC-prod = 4 MC-prod = 22.8 MC), Pluto (2×1 card = 6-7 MC), Ganymede (2×1 plant-prod = 16 MC). Total value: ~20-35 MC depending on colony.
reasoning: Сильная colony прелюдия. Placement bonus TWICE = double value на лучших колониях. Luna colony с double bonus = 4 MC-prod gen 1 — огромно. Mars + Space теги полезны для planetary tracks. Проблема: требует Colonies expansion и зависит от available колоний. С Luna/Ganymede — A-tier прелюдия. С Callisto — посредственная. В среднем ~27-28 MC = выше среднего.
when_to_pick: Берём с Colonies в игре и сильными колониями (Luna, Ganymede). Пропускай без Colonies.
